Just a note - a change like that is a regression, because tables defined with the old fully qualified plugins names (e.g. com.pivotal.pxf.plugins.hdfs.StringPassResolver) won't work. This should probably added to release notes.

@hornn I completely agree. I think Goden created a task for it.
Besides, all of our documents will need to be updated along with this change.
+1 The change is good to me.

@shivzone Perhaps we should have a user friendly error message in case the plugin in question starts with "com.pivotal.pxf", recommending to reconstruct the table with a plugin that starts with "org.apache.hawq.pxf". We can put it in the code where the plugin names are instantiated (Utilities.createAnyInstance)

Overall looks good to me, but git doesn't seem to be able to do a diff this large making the review difficult to complete here on github.  I wonder if the apache review tool might do a better job?
The removal of deprecated tools looks good to me. +1

Hi Yi, 

I think it is better to keep the name of pg_stat_resqueues() unchanged. Otherwise it is hard for user or DBA to keep legacy application/doc/tools working. Thanks.
pg_resqueue_status is another existing UDF/view as well. I think pg_stat_resqueues is redundant.
Hi Lirong, does it mean we can support hash to random conversion in 'explain' now?
Yes, I think so. Please have a try, and let me know if anything wrong.

Hi Yi,

The purposes for these 2 views pg_catalog.pg_stat_resqueues and gp_toolkit.gp_resqueue_status are different. 
- The first one is used to monitor a resource queue's workload over time from the aspect of queries' execution time.
- The second one is focus on each resource queue's limitation setting(quota) and the resource has been occupied by active queries.

So you can't delete any of them.
There is also a fix due to this new implementation, unavailable segment is not considered when building resource request to libyarn/none resource broker.

Is there any particular reason that we move pgbench from contrib to src/bin? 

Other than that, the fix looks good to me. +1
@huor most of the binaries are already in src/bin. So, I found it intuitive to locate pgbench under that. Besides that the make file change is much simpler for src/bin.
